FileAreadyExistsOverwriteConfirmation.Value: File already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?

RightClickToShowContextMenu.Value: Press the right mouse button to show the context menu

GenerateMapsTooltip.Value: Click here to START to generate the maps

AbortMapsTooltip.Value: Click here to ABORT the generation process

MinimizeTooltip.Value: Click here to minimize the xNormal window

PluginManagerTooltip.Value: Click here to show the plugin manager

ButtonSoundsTooltip.Value: Click here to enable/disable the button sounds

HaltedTooltip.Value: This indicator changes its color to show if xNormal is halted or not

ClickToBrowseTexture.Value: Click here to browse the image or texture

BrowseTextureDialogTitle.Value: Please, select the image or texture

ClickToResetTexture.Value: Click here to reset the image or texture

HighpolyButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to show the high definition meshes list and their options

HighpolyVisibleTooltip.Value: Check it to make the high definition mesh visible ( in the 3D viewer and for the raytracer )

HighpolyFileTooltip.Value: File containing the high definition mesh. Right click to show the context menu

HighpolyBaseTextureToBakeTooltip.Value: Base texture of the high definition model that will be projected into the low definition one

HighpolyBaseTextureIsTSNM.Value: Base texture is a tangent-space normal map

HighpolyMenu_BrowseMeshesDialogTitle.Value: Please, select the HIGH DEFINITION models to ADD

MeshFileExtensionTooltip.Value: Mesh's file extension ( for example, obj ) without any point

ImageFileExtensionTooltip.Value: Image file extension ( for example, jpg ) without any point

LowpolyButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to show the low definition meshes list and their options

LowpolyVisibleTooltip.Value: Check it to make the low definition mesh visible ( in the viewer and in the raytracer )

LowpolyFileTooltip.Value: File containing the low definition mesh. Right click to show the context menu

LowpolyMaxRayDistanceFrontTooltip.Value: Uniform maximum ray distance ( for frontal rays )

LowpolyMaxRayDistanceBackTooltip.Value: Uniform maximum ray distance ( for rear rays )

LowpolyUseCageTooltip.Value: Check it to use an user-defined mesh cage for maximum ray distances

LowpolyExternalCageWarning.Value: If you specify an external cage file please SURE the selected mesh has ABSOLUTELY THE SAME topology than the lowpoly mesh or you will get errors...

LowpolyBatchProtectionTooltip.Value: Check it to prevent the pixels of this mesh to be overwritten by the next batch-rendered mesh

LowpolyExternalCageFileTooltip.Value: Right click to show the menu to load the external cage file

LowpolyAONormalsOverrideFileTooltip.Value: Select a normal map to override the highpoly hit normals in the ambient occlusion calculation

LowpolyAONormalsOverrideTangentSpaceTool.Value: Mark it to use a tangent-space normal map or keep it unchecked to use an object-space one

LowpolyRenderOrderTooltip.Value: Batch render order. Meshes will be rendered from TOP to BOTTOM

LowpolyMenu_BrowseMeshesDialogTitle.Value: Please, select the LOWPOLY models to ADD

LowpolyMenu_BrowseCageDialogTitle.Value: Please, select the external cage mesh file

NormalmapButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to show the map options

NormalmapOutputFileTooltip.Value: Select here a file name for the output maps using the '...' button

NormalmapSizeTooltip.Value: The size, in pixels, of the output maps. I don't recommend you to pass 2048x2048 or will be very slow and will consume tons of memory

NormalmapGenerateMipmapsTooltip.Value: Check it to generate very accurate mipmaps. Uncheck it if you don't need mipmaps.

NormalmapClosestHitIfRayFailsTooltip.Value: Use closest hit if there is no ray collision between the lowpoly mesh and the highpoly mesh. Keep it checked to avoid problems.

NormalmapDiscardBackFacesHitsTooltip.Value: Check it to discard the ray hit if the lowpoly normal and the highpoly normal are opposite

NormalmapSwizzleCoordinatesTooltip.Value: You can transform the final coordinates using this

NormalmapTangentSpaceTooltip.Value: Check it to generate a tangent-space normalmap. Uncheck it to use an object-space normalmap

NormalmapBakeHighpolyBaseTex.Value: Bake highpoly base texture in lowpoly

NormalmapBakeHighpolyBaseTexTooltip.Value: Check it to bake the high definition mesh base texture into the low definition mesh

NormalmapRendererTooltip.Value: Select here the renderer to use

NormalmapGenerateAmbientOcclusionTooltip.Value: Check it to generate ambient occlusion map

NormalmapAODistributionTooltip.Value: Choose here the ambient occlusion distribution. Uniform gives cleaner results and cosine darker usually

NormalmapMinValueInvalid.Value: Invalid min value ( need to be less or equal than the max value ). Perhaps you need to change first the maximum value and then the minimum one...

ImageFilterMenu_Tooltip.Value: Click the right mouse button to show the filter menu

FineDetailButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to open the fine detail options

FineDetailFileTooltip.Value: Select here using the '...' button a signed heightmap image for the fine micro-detail

FineDetailBlendFactorTooltip.Value: Blending mix factor. Zero means no detail will be added to the normalmap. One means you will see only the detail and you won't see the generated normalmap at all. 0.5 means a 50% of the detail will be mixed with the generated normalmap

ToolsButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to open the tools

ToolsSmoothTooltip.Value: This controls how abrupt the normal will be

ToolsMethodTooltip.Value: This controls the generation method. Faster method(and sharper) is the four samples. To get smoother results use the 7x7 filter

ToolsNormalmapToCavity.Value: Tangent-space normal map to cavity map

ToolsConvertObjectToTangentSpace.Value: Convert object space to tangent space

ToolsConvertTangentToObjectSpace.Value: Convert tangent space to object space

ToolsPrecisionWarning.Value: You set FP16 and more than 2048 samples. Depending on your GPU this could be or not possible so, if you see an incorrect result, please decrease the number of samples or change to CPU/FP32 precision

ToolsCosineWeightingWarning.Value: Bright greater than 1.0 is not recommended when using cosine weighting... but well... you're who decide...

ToolsSimpleGPUMeshDenseWarning.Value: The mesh is very dense. Some graphics cards don't allow to use meshes with more than 1 or 16 million vertices or triangles. If you observe a completely black or white final result can be due to this.

ToolsSH.Value: Environment cube map to ambient cube map generator

ToolsSHNumberOfBandsTooltip.Value: More means less blur. Less means more blur.

Viewer3DButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to show the 3D viewer options

Viewer3DMeshTooltip.Value: Use the combobox to select a mesh in order to edit its properties

Viewer3DCastShadowsTooltip.Value: Check it if you want this mesh to cast shadows over other meshes

Viewer3DReceiveShadowsTooltip.Value: Check it if you want this mesh to receive shadows from other meshes

Viewer3DBackfaceCullTooltip.Value: Check it to hide the faces not pointing to the camera in order to optimize the rendering speed

Viewer3DTangentSpaceTooltip.Value: Check it if the normalmap is in tangent space or uncheck it if for object space

Viewer3DHeightTexTooltip.Value: The height map texture for parallax mapping

Viewer3DEnableFresnelTooltip.Value: Check it to make the surfaces pointing to the camera more reflective

Viewer3DFresnelRefractiveIndexTooltip.Value: A value indicating how much light must reflect the surface. 1.33 is water, 2 is a diamond, 30 is a mirror

Viewer3DGlossTexTooltip.Value: Gloss texture multiplies the reflection texture. Use this to make some pixels reflective or non reflective

Viewer3DEmissiveTexTooltip.Value: Emissive texture will add a light 'glow' even when there is no light present

Viewer3DSpecularTexTooltip.Value: The RGB values of the specular texture will multiply the specular factor of the light. The ALPHA will be used to control the Phong-exponential term ( more means sharper )

Viewer3DDiffuseGITexTooltip.Value: Diffuse cubemap with the environmental lighting low-frequency distribution. Ideal to simulate outdoor environments

Viewer3DRunWindowedTooltip.Value: Click here to run the 3D viewer in windowed mode ( non fullscreen )

Viewer3DVideoModeTooltip.Value: Select here the video mode the 3D viewer will use

Viewer3DPlayMusicTooltip.Value: Check this if you want xNormal to play some background music while you use the 3D viewer

Viewer3DUseXBox360GamepadTooltip.Value: Check it to use the XBox 360's controller inside the 3D viewer

Viewer3DLaunchTooltip.Value: Press here to start the 3D viewer

SettingsAndExamplesButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to open the settings options and the examples

SettingsLoadTooltip.Value: Click here to load a XML file with a previously saved settings

SettingsLoadDialogTitle.Value: Please, select a XML file to LOAD containing previously-saved settings

SettingsRestoreTooltip.Value: Click here to reset the default settings

SettingsRestoredOK.Value: Settings were restored with the default values

SettingsSaveTooltip.Value: Click here to save the current settings to a XML file

SettingsSaveDialogTitle.Value: Please, select a XML file where to SAVE the current settings

AcidButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to load the 'smiley' example

WallButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to load the wall example

DiabloButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to load the Pablo Hoyos's Diablo example

XemakosButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to open the Paul Greveson's General Xemakos example

SyliaButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to open the Kevin George's Sylia example

FlagButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to open the flag example

MirroredUVsAndHardEdgesTooltip.Value: Click here to open the mirrored UVs and hard edges example

SupportAndAboutButtonTooltip.Value: Click here to open the support and about window

ALTENTERToAttach.Value: Mouse released. Press ALT+ENTER to attach

SaveMeshesAutoAssign.Value: Do you want to auto-assign the saved meshes into your mesh slots?
